comments: Sequences of period k composed of (k-p) zeros followed by p ones have a closed formula of floor((n mod k)/(k-p)), for p >= floor(k/2). - _Gary Detlefs_, May 18 2011
references: R. Gold, Characteristic linear sequences and their coset functions, J. SIAM Applied. Math., 14 (1966), 980-985.
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,0,0,1).
formula: a(n) = floor((n mod 5)/3). - _Gary Detlefs_, May 18 2011a(n+2) = A198517(n+4)-A198517(n+2)+A198517(n). - _Bruno Berselli_, Nov 02 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
